component.name: azure-eventgrid
component.title: Azure Event Grid
component.description: Send events to Azure Event Grid topics.
component.label: cloud,messaging

lazyStartProducer.label: producer
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

publisherClient.label: producer
publisherClient.description: The EventGrid publisher client. If provided, it will be used instead of creating a new one.

autowiredEnabled.label: advanced
autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

accessKey.label: security
accessKey.description: The access key for the Event Grid topic. Required when using ACCESS_KEY credential type.

azureKeyCredential.label: security
azureKeyCredential.description: The Azure Key Credential for authentication. This is automatically created from the accessKey if not provided.

credentialType.label: security
credentialType.description: Determines the credential strategy to adopt

tokenCredential.label: security
tokenCredential.description: Provide custom authentication credentials using an implementation of TokenCredential.

CamelAzureEventGridEventType.description: The event type of the event.

CamelAzureEventGridEventTime.description: The time the event was generated.

CamelAzureEventGridId.description: The unique identifier for the event.

CamelAzureEventGridDataVersion.description: The schema version of the data object.

topicEndpoint.description: The topic endpoint URL where events will be published.

publisherClient.label: producer
publisherClient.description: The EventGrid publisher client. If provided, it will be used instead of creating a new one.

lazyStartProducer.label: producer,advanced
lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

accessKey.label: security
accessKey.description: The access key for the Event Grid topic. Required when using ACCESS_KEY credential type.

azureKeyCredential.label: security
azureKeyCredential.description: The Azure Key Credential for authentication. This is automatically created from the accessKey if not provided.

credentialType.label: security
credentialType.description: Determines the credential strategy to adopt

tokenCredential.label: security
tokenCredential.description: Provide custom authentication credentials using an implementation of TokenCredential.
